dynamicports.displayName: Has Reached Fields in a Collection
dynamicports.name: reached-Fields in a Collection

comments.text: Refreshes the Auth Token for the Logged-in User.

1. Before using this component, do make sure that you have imported the Directus SDK. To do so, you could add the following code in the 'Head Code' setting:
--------------------------------
<script type="module">
  import * as Directus from "https://esm.sh/@directus/sdk";
  window.Directus = Directus;
</script>
--------------------------------

2. This component creates a separate Directus SDK Client, dedicated for use by the App (without any user login). It will operate parallely with the Directus SDK Client that is linked to the 'logged-in user'.

You have the option to initialize this (Site Client) with either a Static Token (https://docs.directus.io/guides/sdk/authentication.html#create-a-directus-client-with-a-token) or the default 'Public' Access Role, by keeping the static_token property empty.

parameters.functionScript:
const url = Noodl.Objects.DirectusSDK?.Client?.url?.origin || null;

if(!url) Outputs.Do()

comments.text:
Warning  

The usage of Flows, especially as Cloud Functions, has to be properly secured.

Do check out the Docs to ensure that the Security of your Directus backend has been ensured before you execute Flows using this component!

1. It is recommended to use POST based Flows, whenever possible
2. In the case of GET based Flows, make sure to provide valid 'query parameters' only

comments.text:
This Utility component tries to first retrieve the Site SDK Client, if installed, and if not, the User SDK Client then.
Outputs the retrieved Client.

If none is available, throws an error.
This component is used to make sure that the SDK Client is properly available.

components.name: /#Directus/Directus Prefab/Initial Set Up/Set up Directus - Option 1 (env)

comments.text: Make sure to have "env.json" set up properly

There are 2 options to include the URL of your Directus project's URL (and optionally, Static Token):

1. Using an environment file (env.json) [For ease of management, and not security]
2. Directly setting the URL

PS: Choose only 1 and remove the other!

This is Option 1 :

- Use env.json
Is the SDK installed and ready to use?

components.name: /#Directus/Directus Prefab/Initial Set Up/Set up Directus - Option 2 (manual)

comments.text:
There are 2 options to include the URL of your Directus project's URL (and optionally, Static Token):

1. Using an environment file (env.json) [For ease of management, and not security]
2. Directly setting the URL

PS: Choose only 1 and remove the other!

This is Option 2 :

- Provide env values directly in Noodl
